location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.1 of 1851 from Lt James Tronson, Honourable Company's brig Euphrates, to Commodore J. P. Porter, Commanding Indian Naval Squadron, Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Tronson reports of his arrival at the island of Inderabia [Jaz카reh-ye Hendor훮b카] and his meeting with Sheikh Abdool Ruzzack ['Abd al-Razz훮q], to which he gave two letters from the Resident (see f 33 for one of the two letters). He also describes a shipwrecked bugla [boat] on the island. Tronson writes that he continued to Sharjah and met with the British Agent Moolah Hussein, who informed him that Sultan ben Suggar [Sultan bin Saqr] and the other Arab chiefs intended to go to Biddeh [Bidda] to assist the Wahhabi chief against Bahrain.
